conclusion: The semicylindrical object has a radius R and light enters at point C, which is at a distance of (sqrt(3)/3)R from the center O.
The diagram shows a semicircle with center O and a point C on the boundary.
The critical angle is when the light refracts at the boundary such that it doesn't exit the right side.
Angle BCO is 30 degrees because tan(30 degrees) = sqrt(3)/3.
Since triangle BOC is a right triangle and angle BCO = 30 degrees, then angle CBO = 60 degrees.
Angle BCO = 30 degrees represents the critical angle for total internal reflection.
The critical angle formula is sin C = 1/n.
Use sin 30 degrees = 1/n to find n.
The refractive index of the transparent object for the monochromatic light is n = 2.
